content.description:
Start near the start of

The Morning After

on a large hold for your right and a crimp for left. Make a couple moves up and left, going around corner.  Top out through the bulge.
Absolutely classic. Climb the super obvious crack/rail from a sit start on the left side of the overhanging north face, then bust left up the face before you hit the fallen tree.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter or two.
content.location: This is on the North face of the FAP ROP Boulder.

content.description:
Team Puff is a cool problem on the left side of the West face of FAP ROP. Start from an obvious jug at waist height, do a big move up and left to an edge, and then go up right to a flake feature continuing to the obvious crack/ groove at the lip. A crimpy traverse into this problem from the beginning of

Fa-Fa-Face

will likely go at around V6.
content.location: This ascends the face and arete on the left side of the West face of FAP ROP.

content.description: The Fa-Fa-Face is a great new line on the West face of the FAP ROP boulder. Sit start with a opposing sidepulls, do a big right hand move to a small crimp, get your feet up, and reach way up left to another small crimp in a crack feature. From there, move up an right via a series of bumps on good crimps to the lip, match the lip (slopey), and find some pebbles on top to pull yourself over. There are 10ish moves in total.
content.protection: Several pads are required due to the slopey nature of the landing. A spotter is nice too.
content.location: This is on the right side of the West face of the FAP ROP Boulder. As of the time of this writing, this will be the first climb you come to if approaching from the direction of Blockhead.

content.description: This is the stand start to the Clipper project. Start at the obvious jug at roughly head height on the steep belly feature forming the northwest corner of FAP ROP. A few powerful moves on good holds put you on the slab. The full line from deep inside the cave is going to be a bad-ass compression problem clocking in somewhere in the V8+ to V10 range.
content.location: It is on the northwest corner of FAP ROP.
